DataElement.preferredName: COVID-19 Vaccine Booster Immunization Administered Date
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The response indicating the date the booster COVID-19 vaccine immunization was administered.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any vaccine that may prevent coronavirus disease-2019 (COVID-19) that is caused by severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2)._A second or later vaccine dose, separated from the first by time, to increase, extend, or maintain the immune response of the previous vaccination._A technique used to cause an immune response that results in resistance to a specific disease, especially an infectious disease._The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Any vaccine that may prevent or treat coronavirus disease-2019 (COVID-19) that is caused by severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2).

Concepts.definition: Any vaccine that may prevent coronavirus disease-2019 (COVID-19) that is caused by severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2).

Property.preferredDefinition: A second or later vaccine dose, separated from the first by time, to increase, extend, or maintain the immune response of the previous vaccination.:A technique used to cause an immune response that results in resistance to a specific disease, especially an infectious disease.:The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

Concepts.definition: A second or later vaccine dose, separated from the first by time, to increase, extend, or maintain the immune response of the previous vaccination.
Inoculating an individual with either killed or live agents to prevent contraction of a disease.
The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Active immunization where vaccine is administered for therapeutic or preventive purposes. This can include administration of immunopotentiating agents such as BCG vaccine and Corynebacterium parvum as well as biological response modifiers such as interferons, interleukins, and colony-stimulating factors in order to directly stimulate the immune system.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The date on which an observation was made or an event occurred.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: a particular day specified as the time something has, or will, happen.

Concepts.definition: The particular day, month and year an event has happened or will happen.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/3/17 tt added Diagnosis CSI. 6/20/17 jk transferred to NCI Standards per confirmation by Brian Campbell as part of Round 5 finalization task, added reg status.
